definition: Huang Xing (1874-1916), revolutionary politician, close collaborator of Sun Yat-sen, prominent in the 1911 Xinhai Revolution 辛亥革命[Xin1 hai4 Ge2 ming4], murdered in Shanghai in 1916
surname Huang or Hwang
yellow/pornographic/to fall through
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
surname Xing
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)

sentences.english: Mayor Huang Xingguo presides over the conference and speaks.
sentences.chinese: 市長黃興國主持會議並講話。

sentences.english: Huangxing walking street is also called Sanxiang business first street, which can be of inner street and outer street.
sentences.chinese: 黃興路步行街具有“三湘商業第一街”的美譽。

definition: Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
provisional government
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
Tang Shaoyi (1862-1939), politician and diplomat
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
military government
Yang Hucheng (1893-1949), Chinese warlord and Nationalist general
student movement
Tongmenghui, Sun Yat-sen's alliance for democracy, founded 1905, became the Guomindang 國民黨|国民党 in 1912
the Northern Warlords (1912-1927)
Feng Yuxiang (1882-1948), warlord during Republic of China, strongly critical of Chiang Kai-shek
Li Dazhao (1889-1927), early Chinese Marxist and founding member of the communist party
Communist International or Comintern (1919-1943), also known as the Third International 第三國際|第三国际[Di4 san1 Guo2 ji4]
army and government
He Yingqin (1890-1987), senior Guomindang general
Zhang Zhizhong (1890-1969), National Revolutionary Army general
